section1.title: What level of hiker
section1.subtitle: are you?
section1.description: Determining what level of hiker you are can be an important tool when planning future hikes. This hiking level guide will help you plan hikes according to different hike ratings set by various websites like All Trails and Modern Hiker. What type of hiker are you â€“ novice, moderate, advanced moderate, expert, or expert backpacker?

section2.title: Picking the right
section2.subtitle: Hiking Gear!
section2.description: The nice thing about beginning hiking is that you don't really need any special gear, you can probably get away with things you already have. Let's start with clothing. A typical mistake hiking beginners make is wearing jeans and regular clothes, which will get heavy and chafe when they get sweaty or wet.

section3.badge: Where you go is the key
section3.title: Understand Your
section3.subtitle: Map & Timing
section3.description: To start, print out the hiking guide and map. If it's raining, throw them in a Zip-Lock bag. Read over the guide, study the map, and have a good idea of what to expect. I like to know what my next landmark is as I hike. For example, I'll read the guide and know that say, in a mile, I make a right turn at the junction.

guide.title: How To Choose The Right Equipment
guide.description: Selecting the right hiking equipment depends on various factors including the type of hike, terrain, weather conditions, and your personal preferences.
tips: Consider the length and difficulty of your typical hikes
Factor in seasonal weather patterns for your hiking locations
Prioritize comfort and proper fit, especially for footwear and backpacks
Balance weight considerations with durability and functionality
